page.title: 12Kirkconnel:Traditions contd.
page.content: It is said locally that Christmas is for the children and New Year for the adults and this is reflected in the way each is celebrated. At Christmas no expense is spared to ensure, as far as possible, that each child has his/her wants met. There are the usual preparations and festivities beginning with the Watch Night service on Christmas Eve. Christmas Day is a family affair with a special meal which may be of turkey, pork,game or a good cut of beef. The important part as far as the children are concerned is the exchanging of presents.Each family may differ in how this is done but usually the children will awake very early to find the stocking they hung up in their bedroom or by the fireplace filled with presents. An apple or orange is usually in the toe.See pg 13
